result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger L Bonds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger L Bonds not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant has been turned over to the State of Indiana.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Roger L Bonds in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Roger L Bonds in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of INDIANA.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
